Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)

= the meaning of this word is uncertain and can only be deduced from its etymology; possible interpretations include: a song that shows understanding, by which the understanding either refers to the structure or to the contents of this song; or: a song that gives understanding; or: a meditation
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= man; ◄ Edomite (אֲדֹמִי) ► official, during the time of king Saul (שָׁאוּל) who betrayed the whereabouts of David (דָּוִד) to his master and later killed the priests of YHWH
= person originating from Edom (אֱדֹום)
= man; ◄ son of Kish (קִישׁ) tribe of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► first king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= man; ◄ son of Ahitub (אֲחִיטוּב) ► father of Abiathar (אֶבְיָתָר) priest (כֹּהֵן) time of king David (דָּוִד)

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= action by which humans express their pride and satisfaction about themselves, their actions, certain circumstances they find themselves in, or a deity that they consider responsible for those circumstances
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= sharp knife ► used to shave hair from the skin; also used to sharpen one's pen
literally: to hammer; hence: = causative action by which humans use an iron tool to cause an object to have a thin cutting edge, ► in order to make it useful and effective as a tool

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= the state in which something false is described or spoken about as true, so that others believe it to be truth
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= marker pointing out that the information that follows represents the logical consequence of what has been stated before
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future
= causative action by which deities remove humans by force from their dwelling place
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
literally: to laugh (at someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities express their lack of respect for (other) humans, often accompanied by laughter
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God
literally: to be strong in something; hence: = state in which humans consider something their source of inner strength and security
= process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= tree reaching up to 10 m. high, but usually pruned to around 5 m.; its leaves are grayish green above, and whitish underneath; its fruit is about 2 cm. long and a bit more than 1 cm. thick with a hard stone inside and a soft skin that covers the oily flesh; ► its fruit is used for food and oil for cooking, for lamps, for rubbing on the body, for medicine, and for anointing; ≈ regarded as beautiful and associated with well being

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= an adverb that specifies unending time
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
literally: to make right; hence: = action by which humans perform their activities in such a way that they are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= someone who practices חֶסֶד, who is committed towards fulfilling his/her obligations; these may be obligations defined within the context of a covenant or agreement, or moral obligations to do well to someone who did well to you before
